name: Avoid using Dynamic instantiation
description:
Dynamic instantiation should be used only when necessary.
Dynamic instantiation is done through calls to:
- 'java.lang.Class.newInstance()'
- 'java.lang.reflect.Constructor.newInstance()' 
- 'java.lang.Class.getMethod(String name, Class... parameterTypes)'
- 'java.lang.Class.getMethods()
- 'java.lang.Class.getField(String name)'
- 'java.lang.Class.getFields()'
- 'java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Object obj, Object... args) 
methods.
output:
This report lists all Artifacts using reflection API methods.
It provides the following information:
 - Artifacts full name
 - the method of the reflection API' that has been called
rationale: Dynamic instantiation is slower than a regular Class invocation or Method call
